name: nytimes
text: The winter solstice arrives in the depths of the pandemic. But the season of darkness also offers ancient lessons of survival, hope and renewal. https://t.co/uFD1BwXgUw https://t.co/eZlOse6pC0

name: nytimes
text: The undeniable hardship of this winter is a reminder that for much of human history, particularly in colder climates, winter was a season simply to be survived. https://t.co/uFD1BwXgUw https://t.co/fnXua9F6Pq

name: nytimes
text: For millennia, during these months of darkness, humans have turned to rituals and stories to remind one another of hope and deeper truths. All over the world, celebrations of light dot the winter darkness like stars. https://t.co/uFD1BwXgUw https://t.co/fEEjVJAQEE

name: nytimes
text: Humans all over the Northern Hemisphere will share nature’s winter ritual of darkness on Monday, whether they acknowledge the winter solstice or not. https://t.co/uFD1BwXgUw https://t.co/RJAQqwIsX3

name: nytimes
text: The great irony of winter is that the moment darkness is greatest is also the moment light is about to return. Each year, the winter solstice comes with the promise that the next day will be brighter. https://t.co/uFD1BwXgUw https://t.co/KJHwczRF01
